description.para: These methods follow the singleton design pattern (only one instance of a class)

briefdescription.para: Create and get the singleton object reference.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns a reference to the object of the Util class. If the class singleton object has not been created, it will be instanciated

parameterdescription.para: The process command line argument number
The process commandline arguments

briefdescription.para: Get the singleton object reference.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns a reference to the object of the Util class. If the class has not been initialised with it's init method, this method print a message and abort the device server process

description.para: Only one destructor is defined for this class

briefdescription.para: The class destructor.
Get a reference to the CORBA ORB.

detaileddescription.para: This is a CORBA _duplicate of the original reference

briefdescription.para: Get a reference to the CORBA Portable Object Adapter (POA)

detaileddescription.para: This is a CORBA _dupilcate of the original reference to the object POA. For classical device server, thisis the root POA. For no database device server, this is a specific POA with the USER_ID policy.

briefdescription.para: Set the process trace level.

parameterdescription.para: The new process level

briefdescription.para: Get the process trace level.
Get the device server instance name.
Get the device server executable name.
Get the device server name.

detaileddescription.para:
The device server name is the device server executable name/the device server instance name
The device server name

briefdescription.para: Get the host name where the device server process is running.
Get the device server process identifier as a String.

simplesect.para: The device server process identifier as a string

briefdescription.para: Get the device server process identifier.
Get the TANGO library version number.

simplesect.para: The Tango library release number coded in 3 digits (for instance 550,551,552,600,....)

briefdescription.para: Get the IDL TANGO version.
Get the device server version.
Set the device server version.

parameterdescription.para: The device server version

briefdescription.para: Set the DeviceClass list pointer.

parameterdescription.para: The DeviceClass ptr vector address

briefdescription.para: Add a DeviceClass to the DeviceClass list pointer.

parameterdescription.para: The DeviceClass ptr

briefdescription.para: Get the DeviceClass list pointer.
Set the serialization model.

parameterdescription.para: The new serialization model. The serialization model must be one of BY_DEVICE, BY_CLASS, BY_PROCESS or NO_SYNC

briefdescription.para: Get the serialization model.

simplesect.para: The serialization model. This serialization model is one of BY_DEVICE, BY_CLASS, BY_PROCESS or NO_SYNC

briefdescription.para: Get a reference to the notifd TANGO EventSupplier object.
Get a reference to the ZMQ TANGO EventSupplier object.
Set device server process event buffer high water mark (HWM)

parameterdescription.para: The new event buffer high water mark in number of events

briefdescription.para: Trigger polling for polled command.

detaileddescription.para: This method send the order to the polling thread to poll one object registered with an update period defined as "externally triggerred"

parameterdescription.para: The TANGO device
The command name which must be polled
If the call failed Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Trigger polling for polled attribute.

detaileddescription.para: This method send the order to the polling thread to poll one object registered with an update period defined as "externally triggerred"

parameterdescription.para: The TANGO device
The attribute name which must be polled
If the call failed Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Fill polling buffer for polled attribute.

detaileddescription.para: This method fills the polling buffer for one polled attribute registered with an update period defined as "externally triggerred" (polling period set to 0)

parameterdescription.para: The TANGO device
The attribute name which must be polled
The data stack with one element for each history element
If the call failed Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Fill polling buffer for polled command.

detaileddescription.para: This method fills the polling buffer for one polled command registered with an update period defined as "externally triggerred" (polling period set to 0)

parameterdescription.para: The TANGO device
The command name which must be polled
The data stack with one element for each history element
If the call failed Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Set the polling threads pool size.

parameterdescription.para: The maximun number of threads in the polling threads pool

briefdescription.para: Get the polling threads pool size.

simplesect.para: The maximun number of threads in the polling threads pool

briefdescription.para: Set the polling thread algorithm to the algorithum used before Tango 9.

parameterdescription.para: Polling algorithm flag

briefdescription.para: Check if the device server process is in its starting phase.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if the server is in its starting phase.

briefdescription.para: Check if the device server process is in its shutting down sequence.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if the server is in its shutting down phase.

briefdescription.para: Check if the device is actually restarted by the device server process admin device with its DevRestart command.

simplesect.para: A boolean set to true if the device is restarting.

briefdescription.para: Connect the process to the TANGO database.

detaileddescription.para: If the connection to the database failed, a message is displayed on the screen and the process is aborted

briefdescription.para: Reread the file database.
Get a reference to the TANGO database object.
Unregister a device server process from the TANGO database.

detaileddescription.para: If the database call fails, a message is displayed on the screen and the process is aborted

briefdescription.para: Get the list of device references for a given TANGO class.

detaileddescription.para: Return the list of references for all devices served by one implementation of the TANGO device pattern implemented in the process

parameterdescription.para: The TANGO device class name
If in the device server process there is no TANGO device pattern implemented the TANGO device class given as parameter Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Get the list of device references for a given TANGO class.

detaileddescription.para: Return the list of references for all devices served by one implementation of the TANGO device pattern implemented in the process

parameterdescription.para: The TANGO device class name
If in the device server process there is no TANGO device pattern implemented the TANGO device class given as parameter Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Get a device reference from its name.

parameterdescription.para: The TANGO device name
If in the device is not served by one device pattern implemented in this process. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Get a device reference from its name.

parameterdescription.para: The TANGO device name
If in the device is not served by one device pattern implemented in this process. Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Get a reference to the dserver device attached to the device server process.

simplesect.para: A reference to the dserver device

briefdescription.para: Get DeviceList from name.

detaileddescription.para: It is possible to use a wild card ('*') in the name parameter (e.g. "*", "/tango/tangotest/n*", ...)

parameterdescription.para: The device name

briefdescription.para: Initialise all the device server pattern(s) embedded in a device server process.

parameterdescription.para: If the device pattern initialisation failed Click here to read DevFailed exception specification

briefdescription.para: Run the CORBA event loop.

detaileddescription.para: This method runs the CORBA event loop. For UNIX or Linux operating system, this method does not return. For Windows in a non-console mode, this method start a thread which enter the CORBA event loop.

briefdescription.para: Cleanup a Tango device server process before exit.

detaileddescription.para: This method cleanup a Tango device server and relinquish all computer resources before the process exit

briefdescription.para: Set the server event loop.

detaileddescription.para: This method registers an event loop function in a Tango server. This function will be called by the process main thread in an infinite loop The process will not use the classical ORB blocking event loop. It is the user responsability to code this function in a way that it implements some kind of blocking in order not to load the computer CPU

parameterdescription.para: The event loop function pointer. This function will not receive any argument. It returns a boolean value. If this boolean is set to true, the device server process exit.

briefdescription.para: The process trace level.
The database use flag (Use with extreme care).

detaileddescription.para: Implemented for device server started without database usage.

briefdescription.para: A daemon process flag.

detaileddescription.para: If this flag is set to true, the server process will not exit if it not able to connect to the database. Instead, it will loop until the connection suceeds. The default value is false.

briefdescription.para: The loop sleeping time in case of the _daemon flag set to true.

detaileddescription.para: This sleeping time is the number of seconds the process will sleep before it tries again to connect to the database. The default value is 60 seconds.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a newly allocated Util object.

detaileddescription.para: This constructor is protected following the singleton pattern

parameterdescription.para: The process command line argument number
The process commandline arguments

briefdescription.para: This class is a used to store TANGO device server process data and to provide the user with a set of utilities method.

detaileddescription.para: This class is implemented using the singleton design pattern. Therefore a device server process can have only one instance of this class and its constructor is not public.
